document.docAuthor: Mohamed Abdelhamid, Marouf Abdel-Aty & Moustafa Azab, Mahmoud

subSubSection.paragraph: MATERIAL EXAMINED. — Six specimens from the Coniacian-Santonian of Abu Roash (Ostrea and Plicatula unit), ASUARE44-49, Abu Roash echinoid horizon 4 ( REH 4).

Test very small, discoidal, low. Both adapical and adoral surfaces flattened. Outline of apical disc large, sub-round. Poriferous zones biserial near apical disc. Major ambulacral plates trigeminate near peristome, quadrigeminate at the ambitus and adapically. Interambulacral area with four columns of imperforate, crenulated primary tubercles. Peristome not sunken, large.

The present species is distinguished from the previously mentioned species of
Phymosoma
, in the present work, in having very small, discoidal and low test; flattened adapical and adoral surfaces, and not sunken peristome.

Cyphosoma thevestense Péron & Gauthier
in Cotteau, Péron & Gauthier, 1879: 105, pl. 8, figs 5-8.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Phymosoma thevestense
–
Abdelhamid & El Qot 2001: 14
, fig. 5A.

subSubSection.paragraph: MATERIAL EXAMINED. — Six measured specimens and numerous non-measured ones from the Coniacian- Santonian of Abu Roash (Ostrea and Plicatula unit), ASUARE50-55, Abu Roash echinoid horizon 4 ( REH 4).

TABLE 4. — Measurements (in mm) of
Rachiosoma rectilineatum (Péron & Gauthier, 1881)
. Abbreviations: see Material and methods.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The present species is distinguished from
Phymosoma major
and
Phymosoma roachensis ( Fourtau, 1914 )
in having two columns of primary tubercles on each interambulacrum. It is distinguished from
Phymosoma abbatei
in having conspicuous biserial poriferous zones adapically, larger apical disc (Ls/D = 0.80 against 0.37-0.42 in
Phymosoma abbatei
), wider ambulacra (Wa/Wi = 0.68-0.80 against 0.62- 0.72 in
Phymosoma abbatei
) and in having narrower extrascrobicular surface. It is distinguished from
Phymosoma baylei
in having smaller test (D = 11.2-19.3 mm vs 24.5-30.0 mm in
Phymosoma baylei
), wider ambulacra (Wa/Wi = 0.68-0.80 vs 0.63-0.73 in
Phymosoma baylei
) and in having narrower extrascrobicular surface. In
Phymosoma beadnelli
, the poriferous zones show conspicuous biserial arrangement from the ambitus to the apex, wide near the apex, where the two poriferous zones constitute 64% of ambulacrum width, the primary tubercles are confluent at the ambitus and adoral surface, and this distinguished it from the present species. The present species is recorded from the Turonian of Algeria and Tunisia , but in Egypt it occurs in the Coniacian-Santonian.
